location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from William Bruce, Acting Resident at Bushire to Jonathan Duncan, President and Governor in Council, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is informing the Bombay Government that a number of men have been retained (rather than sent back to India) at the request of Mahomed Khan Yumborrackcher Basker, in order to repair gun carriages damaged on the road from Bushire. It further explains that had this request not been met, the ordnance in question would remain at its current location for some time.
